sentences.en: "That's too bad," Teddy said without rancour.
sentences.cn: “那太糟糕了！”特迪并无怨怒地说道。

sentences.en: Jo was chastising his teddy bear in the living room.
sentences.cn: 乔在起居室里严厉地惩罚他的玩具小狗熊.

sentences.en: Taylor told her mother that she wanted to buy 500 teddy bears for kids with cancer.
sentences.cn: 泰勒告诉她母亲,她想买五百只泰迪熊送给罹患癌症的小朋友.

sentences.en: Teddy clucked his tongue like a disapproving English matron.
sentences.cn: 特迪咂了咂舌头，活像个不以为然的英国女舍监。

sentences.en: Teddy glanced at papers spread around the office.
sentences.cn: 特迪扫了一眼办公室里到处堆着的文件.

sentences.en: Teddy is a great believer in finding happy medium.
sentences.cn: 特迪是个十足的中庸之道的信仰者.

sentences.en: Teddy raised his hands as if the answer didn't matter.
sentences.cn: 特迪摊开双手,好象怎么 说 并不那么要紧似的.

sentences.en: Teddy ran thick fingers through his unruly thatch of hair.
sentences.cn: 泰迪用自己的粗手指头捋了一下浓密蓬乱的头发。

sentences.en: Teddy turned to Mona with a look of mild confusion.
sentences.cn: 泰迪表情略带困惑地向莫娜求助。

sentences.en: Teddy Upshaw mouthed the words as if trying them on, then affirmed.
sentences.cn: 特迪·厄普肖清晰地念出这几个字,好像品尝其中的味道, 然后予以肯定.

sentences.en: Teddy Upshaw, who used to be your boss , will now report to you.
sentences.cn: 特迪·厄普肖, 你以前的顶头上司, 现在要听你的指派.

sentences.en: Teddy's energetic, bouncing head punctuated his remarks.
sentences.cn: 特迪有力地点着头来加重他的语气.

sentences.en: The FBI was started under Teddy Roosevelt by Attorney General Charles Bonaparte.
sentences.cn: 联帮调查局是在特迪·罗斯福领导下由司法部长查理·波拿巴创建的.

sentences.en: The little boy went upstairs trailing his teddy bear behind him.
sentences.cn: 那小男孩儿走上楼去,还拖着他的玩具熊.

phrases.tran_cn: 泰迪·罗斯福（美国第26任总统）

trans.tran_cn: 妇女连衫衬裤，泰迪玩具熊，特迪
